records.location_details: Evros, Greece. Specific location details are redacted.
records.context_note: HP Officers found 2 migrants (male and female) and a dead body (male). The migrants stated the dead person was their father, a SYR national, who had entered Greece illegally from Evros river a few hours ago. The migrants were apprehended for illegal entry. The dead body was transferred to Alexandroupolis' Hospital for autopsy, which showed heart attack as the reason for death. The children stated their father had heart problems.
records.evidence_quote: HP Officers of BCU Text removed - justification 3 who were patrolling close to Text removed - justification 3 area found 2 migrants (male and female) and a dead body (male). Those 2 migrants stated that the dead person is their father - SYR national and they had entered the Greek territory illegally from Evros river a few hours ago.

records.location_details: Evros, Greece, close to the Greek bank of the Evros river. Specific location details are redacted.
records.context_note: One male dead body (about thirty years old) was found in the Evros river, close to the Greek bank. The body was transferred to Alexandroupolis' Hospital for autopsy, which was requested by Hellenic Police to identify the reason of death. The autopsy showed no criminal activity caused the migrant death. It is likely to be a migrant who tried to cross the border.
records.evidence_quote: On 14-05-2020 at 11:00, one (1) male dead body (about thirty years old) has been found in the river of Evros, close to the Greek bank, in the area of Text Removed - Justification 3

records.location_details: Feres, Evros, Greece, in the Loutra area.
records.context_note: HP Officers of Alexandroupolis' Police Station were informed by a passing person about a dead body (male) found in Loutra area. No travel documents were found. The body was transferred to Alexandroupolis' Hospital for autopsy, which was requested by Hellenic Police. The autopsy showed no criminal activity caused the migrant death.
records.evidence_quote: On 13-05-2020 at 12:00 HP Officers of Alexandroupolis' Police Station were informed by passing person, who was moving close to Loutra area that a dead body (male) has been found in the area. No travel documents have been found.

records.location_details: Evros, Greece. Shots were heard from the Turkish side.
records.uncertainty_note: Specific location details are redacted. Shots heard from Turkish side, location of firing unclear.
records.context_note: Four shots were heard on 12.05.2020 at 23:30 from the Turkish side. No Turkish Land Forces or other persons were observed. Greek authority could not assess where the shots were fired from. The incident was reported in a shift report, but personnel were not directly affected. A recommendation was sent to all deployed personnel in Evros OA to wear protective gear when patrolling close to the border.
records.evidence_quote: 13.05.2020 during daily text removed - justification 2 meeting text removed - justification 2, 4 informed about 4 (four) shots heard on 12.05.2020 at 23:30 from the Turkish side.

records.context_note: Information received about a person deployed under RBI 2020 Evros who was transported to Alexandroupolis hospital with severe bellyache, diagnosed as possible appendicitis. Due to fever, treated as possible COVID case. The person will stay in hospital for medical checks, COVID test results pending. Doctor recommended recovery at hotel, antibiotics, and follow-up visit. Surgery is likely if appendicitis confirmed, life not in danger. Full recovery expected by end of May/beginning of June.
records.evidence_quote: 12.05.2020 at 16:50 the information came from text removed - justification 4 regarding to text removed - justification 4 deployed under RBI 2020 Evros who was transported by Text removed - justification 2, 4 to Alexandroupolis hospital, having sevre bellyache.

records.location_details: Evros, Greece. Specific location details are redacted.
records.context_note: Two new shooting incidents reported on 06.05.2020 in the Evros area. First, at 14:40, 2 gunshots from a Turkish patrol boat with three persons. Second, at 14:45, 4 gunshots from another Turkish patrol boat with six persons. Both incidents reported by GRC Army, likely caused by Turkish Gendarmerie. No Frontex personnel were involved. Special attention and detailed briefing recommended for personnel deployed to the area, with a recommendation to wear protective gear and keep safety precautions.
records.evidence_quote: inform him about two new shooting incidents in Text removed - justification 3, in the same location where shooting incident took place a few days ago: 1- 14:40 hours, 2 gunshots, from a Turkish patrol boat with three persons on board. 2- 14:45 hours, 4 gunshots, from another Turkish patrol boat with six persons on board.

records.location_details: Evros, Greece. Specific location details are redacted.
records.context_note: On 06.05.2020, HP Officers of a Police Station were informed by a person about a dead body (male), aged 30-35, found in the Evros area. No travel documents were found. The body was transferred to Alexandroupolis' Hospital for autopsy. On 15.05.2020, information indicated the deceased was a migrant (nationality unknown) and the autopsy excluded criminal activity as the cause of death.
records.evidence_quote: On 06-05-2020 at 17:15 HP Officers of Text removed - justification 3 Police Station were informed by a person, that a dead body (male), aged between 30-35 has been found in Text removed - justification 3 area.

records.location_details: Evros river, Greece. Specific location details are redacted.
records.context_note: On 28.04.2020 at 19:45, an HP Officer patrolling near the Evros river reported a shooting incident by a Turkish Gendarmerie patrol. A gunshot was heard from the Turkish side at 19:30. A Turkish soldier was seen aiming an assault rifle, then showed a middle finger. Two Turkish patrol boats were observed. The incident was confirmed by another officer. HP LO was informed, and patrols remained until tension de-escalated. Nobody was injured. The incident was assessed as a provocative action. An alert note was distributed, recommending avoiding provocation and wearing protective gear.
records.evidence_quote: On the 28th of April at 19.45 HP Officer of BCU Text removed - justification 3 while patrolling with text removed - justification 4 close to Evros river reported a shooting incident by Turkish Gendarmerie patrol that was patrolling in a close distance at the Turkish bank of the river.
